page.title: 16ATTITUDES
page.content:
Parts of this area have been described as villages surrounded by industry. In the past people had a particular attitude to maintaining an independence from outside, and yet a dependence upon each other, and the areas resources.
There was a pride in living here, despite the poverty, poor conditions, and hard work. Now, most of the area has been absorbed into large local government boroughs, and there has been a movement of population, so the traditional attitudes are being broken up. There is still poverty and unemployment, but not the same community spirit, and independence. As someone said of a man who moved into the area, "'E's not one of we".
